dc:title: Wells' Criteria for Pulmonary Embolism
dc:description: Given features of the patient's history and presenting symptoms and signs, computes a score that can be used to estimate the probability of a non-pregnant adult patient having a pulmonary embolism in the emergency department.

clin_sx_dvt.description: True if the patient has clinical signs or symptoms of DVT (deep vein thrombosis). False otherwise.

pe_1_dx.description: True if pulmonary embolism is the leading diagnosis or equally likely as another diagnosis. False otherwise.

hr_gt_100.description: True if the patient's heart rate is greater than 100 beats per minute. False otherwise.

immob_surg.description: True if the patient has been immobilized for at least 3 days or has had surgery in the previous 4 weeks. False otherwise.

prev_dx.description: True if the patient has previously been objectively diagnosed with DVT or pulmonary embolism. False otherwise.

hemoptysis.description: True if the patient is experiencing hemoptysis. False otherwise.

malignancy.description: True if the patient has a malignancy that has been treated within the past 6 months or has received palliative care. False otherwise.
